author: mini_mads1980
title: Undercover Police Bike
review:
Overview

A motorbike and yet another policeman is provided with Issue 23 of the Lego City Comic.  You don't get any additional sets attached, but as ever the set relates to the story within the comic.

Packet

The front of the foil packet shows the motorbike and has a very nice nighttime scene in the background that shows a police plane and helicopter.  The motorbike seems to be racing along a high speed road to arrest the crook from Issue 1 in 2017 as we are still yet to have another to go with him and this is the eighth police set on the front of comics!

The back has the standard safety information and a 1:1 scale image of the handcuffs above the set number.

Minifigure

We are this time istroduced to Harry Holdem, which is all he can really do on his motorbike if he does catch any crooks.  This particular minifigure only appears in one other set (60244).  The helmet and legs are very common, his head has appeared in 21 other sets since 2012 and the torso was first introduced in 2019 and can be found in a total of ten sets, including this one.

The minifigure suits the set perfectly, but once again I think Lego need to add an extra one for the playability.  If you only collected the comics your 8 police would outnumber the single crook!

Main Build/Parts

The motorbike is built in six steps, but you don't really need instructions to put this together as it is very standard.  No parts jump out as special, although the fairing in white has only appeared in six police sets, and each time with a sticker.  This time there is no sticker or print so the motorbike must be an undercover one.  If Lego can print on the green fairing from 60255 there is no reason they can't for this.  There are two varieties of stickers, but even printing the 2020 version would cover this and the three police sets it also appears in.

Verdict

I do like the set, but it could so easily be improved with one extra minifigure or even a little printing.  I understand that costs need to be limited and it's great to get a bike, but it's only been a few issues since the exact same piece, but in red, was on the front of the comic, so a little variation would be appreciated.

With the comic only having one set on the front the price in the UK dropped back to £4.25, which is great value - especially with Collectable Minifigures now being sold at £3.50, so that works out as £0.75 for a motorbike and a comic!

The next set will be a Fireman with a drone.
